Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: smooth, long, alternate arrangement, has a sheath, taper to long tip
Flowers: late July – August, up to 0.5cm long on large conspicuous inflorescence, silver, silky, drape to one side
Fruits/Seeds: mature seeds have hairs and appear “fluffy”, grey sheen
Range: Northeast US Range: most northeast states
Native Range: origin unclear, currently found in Asia, Africa, America, Europe, Australia
